intro: Protea roupelliae subsp. roupelliae, commonly known as the Roupell's protea, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences composed of numerous white to pinkish flowers arranged in a rounded head. The plant typically grows in coastal fynbos vegetation, preferring well-drained, acidic soils. It is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
